alert.note: Alert for Steele (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 10:49AM CDT until April 23 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast North Dakota, including the following county, Steele. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1049 AM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain and snowmelt in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring, with multiple road closures ongoing. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Isolated higher totals are also possible within heavier thunderstorms this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Golden Lake, Finley, Blabon and Sherbrooke.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
